questions.question: 1. Which one of the following is true in the KMP String searching algorithm?(strInd = iterator in the main string)

answers.a: The value of strInd always increases in all iterations.
answers.b: The value of strInd remains the same in all the iterations.
answers.c: The value of strInd may or may not increase in all the iterations but it never decreases.

explanations.c: The value of the iterator in the main string remains same when there is a mismatch of characters while the iterator in the pattern decreases according to the LPS(Longest Prefix-Suffix) array of the string.

questions.question: 2. How does KMP improve the brute-force-method?

answers.a: By comparing the characters right to left instead of left to right.
answers.b: By searching for text in pattern instead of pattern in string
answers.c: By not doing redundant comparisons and using the information gained from previous comparisons

explanations.c: Using the LPS (Longest Prefix-Suffix) array , the KMP algorithm  decides which character to compare next instead of just shifting the whole string and starting comparing from the index 0 again
